question: The venom of krait is
exp: Ans. (D). Neurotoxic(Ref: Review of Forensic Medicine and toxicology; Gautum Biswas; 2nd edition; Pg-527). Elapidae - NeurotoxicQ venom. Viperidae - VasculotoxicQ venom. Hydrophidae - MyotoxicQ venom

question: Brown colour of contusion is due to:
exp: Ans. (C). Haemosiderin(Ref: Review of Forensic Medicine & toxicology; Gautum Biswas; 2nd edition; Pg- 193). Colour. Pigment. Time Duration. Red. Oxy hemoglobin. Fresh. Blue. QDeoxyhemoglobin. QFew hours - 3 days. Brown. QHemosiderin. Q4 -5 days. Green. Biliverdin/ hematoidin6 -7 days. Yellow. Bilirubin7-14 days

question: A rugby player hit his head on the post whilst involved in a tackle. He was unconscious for 5 min but regained full consciousness and sat on the sideline until the end of the game. He was then noted to be drowsy and over the past 30 min became confused and no longer obeyed commands. Most likely diagnosis is:
exp: Ans. (A). Extradural hematoma(Ref: Review of Forensic Medicine & toxicology; Gautum Biswas; 2nd edition; Pg - 482). The history suggests LUCID INTERVAL, which is a feature seen in extradural hemorrhage. Head Trauma - Unconsciousness, Consciousness & finally unconsciousness, death

question: Heimlich manoeuvre is indicted for:
exp: Ans. (C). Choking. Heimlich manoeuvreQ is a first aid procedure used to treat choking or upper airway obstructions by foreign objects. The term Heimlich manoeuvre is named after Dr. Henry Heimlich.
